titleStmt.title: William T. Samuels to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4709

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky,
WILLIAM T. SAMUELS, Auditor.
EDGAR KEENON, Assistant Auditor.
James M. Withrow, Clerk.
Uberto Kennon, Clerk.
R. R. Bacon, Clerk.
John A Crittenden, Clerk.
Jno. W. Pruett, Jr. Clerk.
Charles T. Miller, Clerk
John L. Sneed, Clerk.

Frankfort, March 31 1864.
Hon Tho. E. Bramlette
Gov. Ky.
Dr. Sir

Jno. F. Cantrill Sheriff of Scott Co. for 1861 this day paid balance on Rev. for said year Interest & Costs, and now prays your Excellency to be delivered from the payment of $1550.40 this being the amount adjudged against him for the nonpayment of the Revenue for said year from said county, at the time required by law

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
J. F. Cantrill
Shff Scott Co
Damages
31st Mch/64

WILLIAM T. SAMUELS,
ATTORNEY AT LAW
AND
GENERAL COLLECTING AGENT,
FRANKFORT, KY.
Special attention given to the collection of all debts confided to him in the State of Kentucky.
